The AgWISE site-specific agronomy tool Introduction

The AgWISE site-specific agronomy tool Excellence in Agronomy, TRANSFORM Team 2022-12-02 Introduction This book documents the structure, functions, and underpinning data for the The AgWISE agronomy tool. AgWISE builds on the AKILIMO decision support tool, and through the TRANSFORM Team of the Excellence in Agronomy CGIAR Initiative is being developed to address the demand from many agronomic advisory use cases across the globe.

Section 1 Inventory of datasets This wiki page documents all of the datasets used by AgWISE. Below we provide a table that summarizes all datasets, and within the table there is a link that documents clearly each dataset and the variables that compose it. Weather and climate: CHIRPS Climate Hazards Group InfraRed Precipitation with Station data (CHIRPS) is a 35-plus year quasi-global rainfall data set. Spanning 50S-50N (and all longitudes) and ranging from 1981 to near-present, CHIRPS incorporates our in-house climatology, CHPclim, 0.05 degree resolution satellite imagery, and in-situ station data to create gridded rainfall time series for trend analysis and seasonal drought monitoring. To learn more about CHIRPS, read Funk et al. (2015). Weather and climate: CHIRTS CHIRTS-daily is a global 2-m maximum temperature (Tmax) product that combines the monthly CHIRTSmax data set with the ERA5 reanalysis to produce routinely updated data to support the monitoring of temperature extreme. To learn more about CHIRTS, read Funk et al. (2019).
